SENT.plain: Extensive thrombus formation during extracorporeal circulation despite the administration of heparin sodium prompted investigation of a 15-year-old boy with a calcified right ventricular thrombus and a history of subacute bacterial endocarditis
In vitro studies confirmed the failure of heparin in standard doses to have an anticoagulant effect
The patient's mother, who had no history of thromboembolic disease, was also antithrombin III deficient
Resistance to heparin is a theoretical, but inconsistently documented, feature of antithrombin III deficiency
This deficiency state should be considered whenever heparin resistance is encountered, even in the absence of a personal and family history of thromboses
